courses.title: Python Coding 1, May Half Term Mini-Camp (28th May - 31st May 2024) - AM
courses.description: The Python coding 1 course is designed for late primary to secondary aged students who are looking to learn to code using a proper “grown-up” programming language. Students will learn to code in Python and create fun games and useful applications. Python is particularly suitable for this age group because it is concise, easy to read and has multiple applications in the real world (web development, app development and other scientific uses such as data science). It is the most popular programming language in the world and is widely used by all the leading tech companies such as Google, Amazon and Facebook. This class is a great introduction to both fundamental coding concepts and the Python programming language. After this course, students will be comfortable coding in Python and have the confidence to extend their knowledge at home.
take_aways: Use all of the above to make a super cool game
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: No prior coding experience necessary. If you have been to one of our camps before or attended a term-long Python 1 class, then we would suggest booking the Python 2 class which covers more advanced topics.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Python Coding 2, Summer Camp (12th June - 16th June 2024) - PM
courses.description: The Python coding 2 course is for students who have a basic understanding of Python and are looking to advance their skills. This course will cover more complex programming concepts and involve creating more sophisticated games and applications. Students will learn about object-oriented programming, working with libraries, and data handling.
take_aways: Create more advanced projects and games
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of Python required. Ideal for students who have completed Python Coding 1.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Python Coding 3, Autumn Term (1st October - 5th October 2024) - AM
courses.description: The Python coding 3 course is designed for students who have advanced Python knowledge and want to explore more complex applications and projects. This course includes topics such as advanced data structures, algorithms, and GUI development. Students will work on real-world projects to apply their skills.
take_aways: Implement complex data structures and algorithms
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: Advanced understanding of Python required. Ideal for students who have completed Python Coding 2.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Scratch Beginner, May Half Term Mini-Camp (28th May - 31st May 2024) - AM
courses.description: The Web Development 1 course introduces students to the fundamentals of web development. Students will learn how to create websites using HTML for structure, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for interactivity. By the end of the course, students will have built their own functional website.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Scratch Intermediate, Summer Camp (12th June - 16th June 2024) - PM
courses.description: The Web Development 2 course is for students who have a basic understanding of web development and want to deepen their skills. This course covers more advanced topics such as responsive design, frameworks, and back-end development. Students will build a more complex web application by the end of the course.
courses.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript required.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Scratch Advanced, Autumn Term (1st October - 5th October 2024) - PM
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Minecraft Beginner, Winter Term (15th December - 20th December 2024) - AM
courses.description: The Introduction to Data Science with Python course is designed for students interested in data analysis and machine learning. Students will learn to use Python libraries such as Pandas and Scikit-Learn to manipulate and analyze data, and build simple machine learning models.
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Minecraft Intermediate, Winter Term (15th December - 20th December 2024) - PM
courses.description: The Advanced Data Science with Python course is for students who have a solid understanding of basic data science concepts and want to delve deeper into advanced techniques. This course covers topics such as deep learning, natural language processing, and complex data visualizations.
take_aways: Work on advanced data science projects
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of data science and Python required.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG
